text: hi guys today's recipe is going to be
probably one of your favorites because
it's a mint and chocolate sandwich
cookie based on one of my all-time
favorites the mint Milano start off by
measuring one and a quarter cups flour
1/2 teaspoon of salt and just whisk
those two together in my mixer I have 1
stick of unsalted butter room temp and
to that I'm adding 2/3 of a cup of
granulated sugar tell me what your
favorite cookie was growing up Milano's
definitely were one of my favorites
though I think I had plenty I did think
that they were very very fancy beat your
butter and your sugar until light and
fluffy one egg a teaspoon of pure
vanilla and then add your dry
ingredients it's a very simple cookie
I'm just gonna add it all at once all
righty
and then just beat obviously on low so
you don't get showered in flour it's a
very soft batter that's pipeable because
well you're gonna pipe these cookies you
can also do this in a piping bag if you
have one get it all into one corner
squeeze it and then you snip off just
the tip of the bag and you can pipe
through there then on a baking sheet
lined with parchment you're just gonna
go ahead and pipe about two inches long
and three quarters of an inch wide
pretty much exactly the right shape I
think if you're using a pastry bag you
might want to put on some kind of tip
that would pipe something a little bit
flat and not so round because that's the
sort of finger shape that you're looking
for you want that so these need to chill
before you bake them but get your oven
preheating to 325 degrees because they
only need to chill for about 20 minutes
and in that time your oven will get hot
so just get these in the fridge and
chill them for 20 minutes and then you
can bake them at 325 until they're firm
and just lightly golden about 15 minutes
to finish your cookies they need to be
cool you're gonna make a little mint
icing so this is three-quarters of a cup
of confectioner's sugar with about 4
teaspoons of water quarter teaspoon of
mint extract whisk it together I have
some chocolate here melted and then you
just sandwich the cookies one cookie
gets a little chocolate
mmm-hmm they're so elegant and one
cookie gets a little bit of the mint
icing and then you sandwich them
together and then unfortunately you have
to wait and let them set try not to eat
them right away don't those look amazing
they look just like the real thing I'm
just gonna keep making them and making
them and you know what even though I'm
supposed to wait and let them set I'm
not gonna I'm gonna try it right now
almost as good as the original
you
